topic.title: Sorry, you can't delete your own site. Please remove the directory manually.
topic.body:
### Step 1: Please describe your environment

  * ZeroNet version: 0.7.0
  * Operating system: Win7
  * Web browser: Chrome
  * Tor status: Enable
  * Opened port: not sure
  * Special configuration: none

### Step 2: Describe the problem:
I created new website. And I'm the only 1 peer and owner. Then I wanted to delete it. And got message: "Sorry, you can't delete your own site. Please remove the directory manually.". So I tried to remove directory manually and then delete website again. Even if I remove directory manually, I'm getting again same error message when trying to delete website. So I can't delete it anyway. So how can I then delete my website?

#### Steps to reproduce:

  1. Create website
  2. Delete website

or

  1. Create website
  2. Delete manually website directory
  3. Delete website

#### Observed Results:

Got error message: "Sorry, you can't delete your own site. Please remove the directory manually."

#### Expected Results:

That my website will be deleted completely.

1604067485_mirrored_payalord_github.body:
Here is screenshot: https://ibb.co/stKSdmt
Do you mean deleting from sidebar like this? If yes then on my end it is not working and I'm getting error message as you can see on this screenshot.
